ch.bfh.ti.gapa.cli.stdin

Class NonBlockingInputStreamImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.bfh.ti.gapa.cli.stdin.NonBlockingInputStreamImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NonBlockingInputStream

    public class NonBlockingInputStreamImpl
extends Object
implements NonBlockingInputStream
    This implementation allows to read asynchronously/non-blocking from an InputStream. A new thread is started that checks every 20ms if a new line is ready to read. The read line is passed to NonBlockingInputStreamHandler.onReadLine(String). The thread closes gracefully if close() is called. Note that the implementation of the InputStream has to overwrite the InputStream.available() method. This class exists because a blocking InputStream.read() call never stops blocking if there is never input. This class allows to stop reading from an input stream even if there is no input.
